philosophy.title: High Modularity Design
philosophy.subtitle: A lesson from electronics history
philosophy.description: The consumer electronics industry abandoned modularity for cheaper production. But infrastructure has different requirements - an EV charger must last 15+ years and be serviceable in the field. We're bringing back the modular approach, enhanced with modern technology.

history.title: Service Evolution: The TV Example
history.subtitle: How the industry lost repairability - and why we're bringing it back

era1.title: Modular Systems
era1.description: A TV set consisted of a chassis and replaceable modules: tuner, IF, video, audio, power supply. Each module had its function and could be independently replaced or repaired.
features: Fault? Diagnosis in 5 minutes - which module is bad
Module swap in the field in 30 minutes
Module goes to workshop - repaired without rush
Technician doesn't need to be expert in all modules

era2.title: Integrated Systems
era2.description: All functions in a few custom chips on one board. Cheaper to manufacture, but impossible to repair. Surface-mount components, proprietary parts, planned obsolescence.
features: Service often more expensive than new device
"Throw away and buy new" - 3-5 year lifespan

era3.title: ELEKTROKOMBINACIJA
era3.description: We combine the best of both worlds: highly modular design enabling fast field replacement, with modern AI diagnostics that predict failures and robotic automation for swap.
features: No technician needed in the field
Module is repaired at service center - by humans
era3.result: 15+ year lifespan, zero downtime, circular economy

workflow.title: Service Process
workflow.subtitle: From prediction to repair - automated and efficient

steps.title: AI Detection
steps.description: System detects module degradation and predicts failure

steps.title: Automatic Swap
steps.description: Robot at swap station replaces module without human intervention

steps.title: Transport
steps.description: Replaced module travels to service center with the next bus

steps.title: Human Repair
steps.description: Technicians at service center diagnose and repair module

field.title: In the Field
field.subtitle: Automated, fast, no waiting
field.point2: AI diagnostics - knows exactly what to replace

service.title: At Service Center
service.subtitle: Human expertise, no rush
service.note: Circular economy - modules return to service

hero.title: ELEKTRO
hero.subtitle: KOMBINACIJA
hero.description: AI that monitors system health, predicts issues, and enables intervention before failure. Goal: maximum reliability.

problem.title: Industry Status
problem.subtitle: 2025 data
problem.quote: "Uptime tells us if a charger is available, but it doesn't tell us if a driver can actually plug in and get a charge on the first attempt."

aging.title: Degradation is still a problem
aging.description: ChargerHelp 2025: 15 point drop that uptime metrics don't capture.

problem.challenge: 99% uptime sounds great. But only 71% of charges succeed on the first try.

product.title: EK3 Module
product.subtitle: One module for everything - from 3 kW to 3 MW
product.description: Radical modularity inspired by 3PAR storage architecture. Same module scales from e-bike to MCS station.

phase2.title: RACK SYSTEM
specs: Wide striping - load across ALL modules

features.title: Why one module for everything?
features.modularDesc: One design, millions of units = low cost

configurations.title: One Module for Everything
configurations.subtitle: EK3: From e-bike to MCS station

depot.title: Light EV
depot.description: E-bikes, scooters, home charging. Same module as in MW station.

opportunity.title: DC Fast Charging
opportunity.description: Cars, highway stations. Rack system, robot-ready module swap.

swap.title: Heavy Duty + MCS
swap.description: Buses, trucks, MCS. Multiple racks, robotic swap, graceful degradation.

team.title: Our Vision
team.subtitle: Return to modularity
team.mission: The industry went down the integration path - everything in one chip, impossible to repair, planned obsolescence. But infrastructure isn't a phone. An EV charger should last 15+ years. We combine 1970s modularity with 2020s AI technology: module swap in the field in 60 seconds, no technician needed, and AI predicts failures two weeks ahead.

robots.title: Coordinated Robot System
robots.subtitle: Two robots, one mission: self-healing infrastructure
